page.title: 04BROADBAY SOUTH - BIRDS
page.content: {Tong Saltings S S S I}forms the breeding grounds for{Little Terns}and the largest colony of{Arctic Terns}in the Outer Hebrides. The terns together with large numbers of divers and sea duck feed in Broad Bay The mudflats and shores form one of the most important feeding sites for waders in North West Scotland. {Bird Species}seen at this site also include:{Waders;}Oystercatcher, Dunlin Turnstone, Purple Sandpiper, Ringed Plover.{Divers;}Great Northern, Black Throated, Red Throated. Gulls; Common, Herring, Great Black Backed, Black Headed, Lesser Black Backed.{Wildfowl; Mallard, Wigeon, Grey-lag Geese, Red Breasted Merganser, Velvet Scoter, Long Tailed Duck, Eider Duck, Common Scoter.
